column3: Blooms of toxic Raphidiopsis raciborskii in Laguna del Sauce (Uruguay): environmental drivers and impacts
column6: This study has 2 periods; 2003-2020 for R. Raciborskii and 2015-2020 for spatio-temporal gradients of phytoplankton (chla measurements). An interesting finding: increased turbidity due to wind suspension of sediment decreases phytos and the greatest amount of phytos were found under low turbidity low water level conditions. deeper water level conditions could also experience blooms when there is low turbidity.
column9:

column3: Distinct differences of vertical phytoplankton community structure in mainstream and a tributary bay of the Three Gorges Reservoir, China
column6: This study doesn't specifically discuss water level increases or decreases, but does make connections between vertical phytoplankton community composition and water level. For example, they found that phytoplankton peaks occurred during low to medium water level periods and tended to be cyano dominated rather than diatom dominated. They propose raising the water level and artificial mixing strategies to reduce phytoplankton diversity in different water levels.
column9: "This study, conducted over two annual cycles with monthly sampling, examines the vertical distribution patterns of phytoplankton under the influence of different environmental factors and water levels."

column3: Succession of phytoplankton assemblages in response to large-scale reservoir operation: a case study in a tributary of the Three Gorges Reservoir, China

column3: Seasonal Variations in Water Quality and Algal Blooming in Hypereutrophic Lake Qilu of Southwestern China
column6: The water quality of the lake has been decreasing for years and the water level of the lake has also been decreasing. They found that TP, water temp, and turbidity are most correlated to chl-a. They suggest raising the water level and reducing TP loading to improve water quality of the lake and prevent HABs. Sampling years 2017 - 2018 and 2020-2021 but present them as continuous. EXCLUDE
column9: "The objectives of this study were to (1) understand the spatiotemporal distribution characteristics of each water quality parameter; (2) assess the water quality and the nutrition level of Lake QL, and; (3) identify the major factors controlling HABs and provide targeted advice to control the pollution in lake QL."
column34: January; February; March; April; May; June; July; August; September; October; November; December
column45:
They don't highlight water level change in the study, but they do mention it a few times. 
 

 "Due to the anthropogenic discharge of water and expanding farmland, the area of Lake QL has dropped sharply from 33.53 km2 in February 2012 to 21.8 km2 in April 2013, and 23 km2 in 2015." This is before the study period 2017-2021, but it does show the water level is consistently decreasing.
